messages.message: To enable provenance tracking what is required?
Just need to check off “Allow Confidence Tracking (BETA)” in Refiner and then Run and Save
When would that flag not want to be enabled. I feel like almost every customer would want this information. Why would we hide the OCR function away in a JSON setting?
at least in SC, it blows up the memory to the point where everything crashes
so if you do {“produce_word_metadata”: true} on documents that go above 1-2 pages, memory and CPU consumption go a bit crazy and prod becomes less stable
once we get all the features in for Goldman, that will be the next big priority for us is getting the CPU and memory in control when we have tons of coordinates flying around
@Matt the Infra team is rebuilding the way our data storage is organized so that we can just always output everything
It’s going to involve some file format changes so will touch our whole stack, which is why it’s taking a while
(we know this is a huge UI/UX problem)
Gotcha thanks for both the explanations makes sense. It's good to know this level of detail to know what to reveal or not reveal to clients
